title: Ticket #6204: DAGMan should throttle jobs in file transfer state?
description:
As per discussion in today's CHTC team meeting: Miron is interested in first, having DAGMan know how many jobs are in the file transfer state (both input and output) at any given time; then, having DAGMan be able to throttle job submission to control the number of jobs in the transfer input files state.

One question is, is it possible to do this with the current set of events, or do we need to add some new events to make this possible? I think that we'd have to add some new events, but I'm not 100% sure, so I'll check.

Another thing to keep in mind is that submit files that queue a large number of jobs can reduce the effectiveness of such a throttle similarly to maxidle, for example.
remarks:
2017-Mar-24 16:59:22 by wenger:
Okay, there are (not-yet-used) provisions for a STAGE_IN_EVENT and STAGE_OUT_EVENT -- presumably those would be what we would need for this...
